profileText: a Senator from New Jersey; born in Jersey City, N.J., October 27, 1979; graduated Glen Ridge High School, Glen Ridge, N.J., 1997; B.A., psychology, Rutgers University, 2009; M.A., finance and management, Harvard University, 2011; staff assistant and constituent advocate to United States Senator Frank R. Lautenberg 2011-2013; deputy state director and state director to United States Senator Cory A. Booker 2014-2019; chief of staff to New Jersey governor Phil Murphy 2019-2023; commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey 2023-; corporate executive; appointed as a Democrat to the United States Senate on August 23, 2024, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Robert Menendez; took the oath of office on September 9, 2024, and served from August 23, 2024, until his resignation on December 8, 2024; was not a candidate for election to the full term.
